alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 8:14PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Logan, northwestern Phillips and Sedgwick Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 814 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Twin Buttes to 5 miles west of Fleming to near Atwood, or along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Chappell to 34 miles west of Holyoke to 8 miles southwest of Sterling. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Julesburg, Haxtun, Fleming, Ovid, Merino, Iliff, Sedgwick, Crook, St Petersburg, Proctor, Atwood, Marks Butte, Willard, Twin Buttes, Logan Corners and Fairfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.
